instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 820-00165-A no display
threads.message:
Hi, I have a MacBook Air A1466 820-00165-A with weird colour lines on display, At first I thought its a broken LCD but it stays the same on another known good LCD and there's no display even on the HDMI ( the system seems to work fine as caps lock key lights up when pressed)
any help would be appreciated,
Thanks.

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 820-00165-A no display
threads.message:
Any history fault available?

Disconnect internal LCD and check again external video.

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 820-00165-A no display
threads.message:
hi yes the external video works only when the internal display is disconnected.
no history of the fault available except it went for some other repair in a shop in Qatar, not working after that

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 820-00165-A no display
threads.message:
The vertical colored lines and white horizontal stripe, looks like bad LCD for me.

If you get exact same behaviour with known good LCD assembly, then check all pull-down resistos R83xx and series capacitors C832x, connected to J8300.
Just in case, change the video connector.

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 820-00165-A no display
threads.message: its sorted, thanks for your help

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 820-00165-A no display
threads.message:
Can you leave solution feedback?
May help other forum members...

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 820-00165-A no display
threads.message: hi, I am afraid it was actually a bad LCD, even the spare I had.
